results.content: I have done a few bits and pieces in the past with Postman and APIs but this has started to give me a wider understanding of the broadness of Web APIs. Thanks.
results.content_html: I have done a few bits and pieces in the past with Postman and APIs but this has started to give me a wider understanding of the broadness of Web APIs. Thanks.

results.content: A rather expensive but useful cookbook about RESTful API design. It can be used as a complement to what you already know. However it won't go in depth, so you are left with the sense that there could be more. Buy if you are already ok with node and want something else on what to spend those $10 extra.
results.content_html: A rather expensive but useful cookbook about RESTful API design. It can be used as a complement to what you already know. However it won't go in depth, so you are left with the sense that there could be more. Buy if you are already ok with node and want something else on what to spend those $10 extra.

results.content: concept lecture on rest and oauth was excellent but the detail code walk through  for twitter example was just rushed. It did not help. Simpler example could have been picked to focus on concepts as it is a beginner course.
results.content_html: concept lecture on rest and oauth was excellent but the detail code walk through for twitter example was just rushed. It did not help. Simpler example could have been picked to focus on concepts as it is a beginner course.

results.content: Straightforward and to the point. Great job!
results.content_html: Straightforward and to the point. Great job!

results.content: There is no coding, just explanations of concepts. Almost like reading a book. I guess I did get some things out of this, but I felt there is no practical use cases other than pre-written code, and an explanation of it.
results.content_html: There is no coding, just explanations of concepts. Almost like reading a book. I guess I did get some things out of this, but I felt there is no practical use cases other than pre-written code, and an explanation of it.

results.content: The instructor needs to go slow...explain concepts rather than reading from a slide...
results.content_html: The instructor needs to go slow...explain concepts rather than reading from a slide...

results.content: The course relies too much on slides and the presenter just reading off a script in a monotone way. For someone new to this information, it's very difficult to have concept after concept rattled off in a series of bullet points. This might be good for someone who has previous experience and just needs a refresher but not for the beginner.
results.content_html: The course relies too much on slides and the presenter just reading off a script in a monotone way. This might be good for someone who has previous experience and just needs a refresher but not for the beginner.

results.content:
The author speaks too fast.
He should give complete examples and not only simplified outlines, but maybe this will come later.
